You said we were special.

The TRACK goes SILENT. BARRY & CLAUDETTE walk along a path.  This is not an aiml walk, for BARRY knows exactly where he wants to go.  He l the path and goes to sit on a log in a small clearing. CLAUDETTE hesitates, then goes to sit next to him.
I care very much.
He puts an arm around her and draws her close.  They kiss They separate.
Does Chloe kiss as good as I do?

I wouldn't know.
Oh, you...

She kisses him and they are locked. A bird calls, wheels across the patch of sky above. The CAMERA shifts to ANOTHER ANGLE:  Just beyond the thic lacy vines.  It is a slow tracking shot which gives the impression that we are watching the action from the POV o another person, an unseen visitor...watching the two teen Assistant Counsellors making their first sexual encounter This unseen observer will be called the PROWLER. BARRY reaches up outside CLAUDETTE'S t-shirt to hold her breast.  She reaches up to take his hand away.
Claudette...
Somebody'll see.
No, they won't...

He ends the argument by snaking his hand inside her t-shi that part of her bra is exposed.  He seals her protesting by kissing her. From the PROWLER's POV, the CAMERA MOVES to get a better A hand moves into FRAME and pulls back some branches to c the field of vision.  A branch pops.
(in a thick whisper) Somebody's there, Barry.
Come on, Claudette.  A man's not made of stone.
Let's go back, Barry...
I need you so much, Claudette.

BARRY leans in and unhooks her bra.  They kiss again, passionately. The PROWLER pauses, then moves, never seen--except for a foot or hand--from the POV of the CAMERA, closer and clos the two TEENAGERS become more and more oblivious. Closer.  The THEME has snuck in. The PROWLER reaches FRAME, picks up the finger, and exits FRAME. Don't forget the big drawing today to see who gets our FRIDAY THE 13TH Monster Surprise: either a man's digital continuous readout watch or a Panasonic color television set!

Don't walk under a ladder!  Don't spill any salt, don't...

The radio is turned way down.  We see that the hand belon TRUDY, a hefty waitress who wears her golden hair in a bu a pencil stuck in it.  BUDDY, the boss, is seen in the BG working the grill. The regulars are there:  five MEN and two WOMEN who alway in for breakfast.  They are the retailers, the oil delive man, the switchboard operators, and the cop. They gonna open that place    Camp Blood? again?

All the girls up there gonna look as good as you?

Camp Crystal Lake?

Something always happens up there.
He turns on the radio in the cab and we hear the DJ again

He nods and shakes his head with the sense of what might been if he were thirty years younger.  He puts it in gear roars off. ANNIE looks around and sees an old gas station. ANNIE is beginning to get worried about the time.  It's h she's late. She looks up. From her POV a Jeep barrels along the road towards us. ANNIE puts out her numb.

From the DRIVER'S POV, we see ANNIE waiting for a lift. DRIVER, unseen, shifts down until ANNIE is alongside.  Th Jeep, an uncovered model, stops.  ANNIE smiles a big deli smile at us as we sit in the DRIVER's seat.
Hiya!  I'm headed for Camp Crystal Lake. Can you help me out?
Apparently the DRIVER nods, because ANNIE beams at us.  S tosses her pack in the back and hops aboard.  The DRIVER accelerates.
The Jeep roars along the road.  The sun and shadows keep from seeing the DRIVER.
Still in the DRIVER's POV, the CAMERA watches as ANNIE lo around, admires the woods, the Jeep, the day.  Things are her way.

I can't remember being this excited about anything.  I want to be a teacher when I finish at Southern State.  I guess I've always wanted to work with children.  I hate it when people call 'em kids.  Sounds like little goats.
The forest outside the speeding Jeep is deeper and signs civilization have all but disappeared.  ANNIE still turns looks at the CAMERA when she speaks to the DRIVER.
(continuing) The job market for teachers is supposed to be the pits these days, but I don't care.  When you have a dream as long as I have, you'll do anything...
A look of surprise passes ANNIE's young face.
(continuing) Wasn't that Camp Crystal Lake?  Just back there?
In the FG the sign for Camp Crystal Lake.  In the BG, the roars off into the distance.
(frightened, confused) I think we better stop... Please stop... Please!  Stop!
The Jeep's speed increases.
(continuing) Please!

ANNIE grabs for the ignition key, but the DRIVER's hand d out and slaps ANNIE away.  We see that this hand is missi little finger! Panicked, without any other recourse, ANNIE looks about h then leaps from the moving Jeep, aiming for the relativel underbrush alongside the narrow road.
ANNIE lands, rolls, is upended, scratched by brambles, an flips.  She scrambles to her feet and starts running towa the camp.
The Jeep stops, turns quickly, heads back for her.

ANNIE's feet pound the hard-packed dirt.  She looks over shoulder to see the Jeep.  The sun flares on the Jeep's windshield, keeping us from being able to see any details the DRIVER. In a final desperate move, ANNIE drives into the underbru escape. The Jeep skids to a stop.

The CAMERA becomes the DRIVER and chases into the thicket Branches and briars snap back at us.  Just ahead, the ter stuck ANNIE stumbles and falls.  She screams as a knife f past her in a blur. When the knife has passed, all we can see is a look of su on ANNIE's face. The CAMERA PULLS BACK.  Her throat has been cut.  She col out of FRAME. A bird soars across the sky above. A gaily decorated camper-van travels along the highway. hear rock 'n roll OVER coming from a car radio as this mu need-of-repair vehicle passes a slower car.

In the camper van are three young people.  They are full fun, fresh and expectant as they head towards Crystal Lak They are instantly likeable. At the wheel is NED, a short 22-year-old whose well-devel upper body is a tribute to his weight-lifting.  He is nic looking, a joker who is always trying to get some attract He is funny and alert. Next to him is JACK, an athlete whose clean-cut look is a American as popcorn.  He is quieter, two years younger an as smart as NED.  He has to think things through. MARCIE is JACK's girlfriend.  She is leaning over the fro passenger seat so she can messenger JACK's shoulders. She is a funny girl, pretty, and always looking for fun. enjoys every minute of every day.  She hasn't been touche tragedy.

There you are dead wrong.
Ha!
Sometimes I only think about kissing women.

Ow!
I was just wondering if you thought there'd by any other gorgeous women at Camp Crystal Lake.  Besides yourself.
You are a true pierce of work, Ned.

(continuing) How about our last jay?
Good call.

Quote:  Controlled substances are expressly forbidden.  Possession or use of marijuana or alcohol on campgrounds will means instant dismissal.  Unquote.
We got two weeks before the kids even arrive.  Then I'll act responsibly. Until then, hit me.
She takes the lighted joint and tokes.
The van turns past the sign that reads: CAMP CRYSTAL LAKE--Established 1935

It's beautiful...
Yeah, and it also look like it hasn't seen a coat of paint in six years.

This is the main building.  It is the building where Barr Claudette met.  Outside is a flagpole, a small parking ar large overhanging tree. In the BG we can see part of the lake. In the FG there is a Jeep.

(continuing) That's got her.  Thanks.  I'm Steve Christy.  Welcome to Camp Crystal Lake. You got some grubby clothes?  Climb into 'em.  Alice, see if Bill has cleaned out the boathouse.  I want him to start with the canoes.  What happened to Brenda?

I'll tell him.

Looks good.
Perfection. Did you meet Brenda?

It is a moody pierce, a sense o foreboding dominates it.  Otherwise, it is the camp's cen compound, featuring the tree that forms the central focus
You draw very well.

This isn't your cup of tea, hunh?

You may not care a lot about this place, Alice, but I mean to make it my whole life.  It's been my whole life.  Gimme a chance.  Stay a week.  Help get it ready.  Next Friday, if you're not happy, I'll put you on the bus myself. I'll be grateful.
He puts out a hand and runs the back of it across her che She looks up.  She nods.
Next Friday.
Thanks, Alice.
He stands up.
(continuing) I've got to go to town and pick up the trailer and all that other stuff, but I'll be back around ten.  If you're still up, we can talk, okay?
Sure.
She watches him cross out of FRAME.
STEVE is at the wheel of his Jeep.  The COUNSELLORS are standing within earshot, huddled around the Jeep.
You want it listed separately?

Yeah.  Brenda, after lunch hit the archery range.  If Annie gets here, have her start in on the kitchen.  Do your best.  Tomorrow we have a preliminary inspection by the state safety people. I'd like to look good.
He wheels the car around and out the driveway.  The other stand looking before NED breaks the silence.

This isn't an easy one-person job The CAMERA CLOSES IN tighter and tighter on her as she ge closer to setting up the target. In MCU, she lifts a target up.  Her head is very close to face of the target.  She gets it up, lets the tripod take weight, and then, just as she lifts her weight back, an a streaks into the center of the gold, missing her head by eighteen inches. BRENDA whips around. WE SEE WHAT SHE SEES:  a very cocky NED, standing by the to with a bow in his hands and three more arrows knocked simultaneously.  He has a feather stuck in his hair. She grabs the arrow and storms at him.
You're crazy!
She snaps the arrow in half.
Did anyone ever tell you you're beautiful when you're angry?
(plussed) I don't believe you...
Want to see my trick shot?  It's even better.
BRENDA still thinks he's a jerk, but he's so outrageous t little she can do.  She laughs.
(still laughing) You ever fire one of those bows again, and I'll tack you up on the wall to dry.
God, but I love that sexy talk.
BRENDA snatches the bow from him, shakes her head and put bow down next to a collection of wicked-looking arrows.

This is a fairly large single room.  The walls are bare a uninsulated.  There are a few easels, but for the most pa the room is dominated by long tables and rough-hewn bench The light seeps through the streaked windows, making the wood interior appear silver-colored.  ALICE, her hair in bandana, has just finished sweeping up. The CAMERA picks up on ALICE's sketch of the central camp on one easel.  On a second easel she has done the prelimi sketch of the lake itself.  It is also a moody picture. ALICE cocks her head to look at the sketches, shivers jus little, then goes on to her next task.  There is a row of arrived cardboard boxes.  She opens the first in CU with matte knife. Did you want something?

Un-hunh.

(continuing) Oh, my God...
You okay?

(continuing) You're lucky.

Maybe I can help?

And it's this place.  It makes no sense, but it spooks me.

Jack?
